Watched the theatrical version last night (which I found messy but brilliant) and am anxious to see the Director's Cut, which is 36 minutes longer and may explain a LOT of holes left in the plot (like a pregnancy!). This comes out official in about a week in DVD and Blu-Ray with both cuts of the film, but apparently will be distributed only by Amazon and Netflix and Blockbuster will not get it. If anyone has the high-def Director's Cut, PLEASE put it up!

Anyone got the Director's Cut,  about 40 minutes longer and may plug a lot of holes in the 129 minute cut. High-res would be nice too ... Amazon has sole distribution of the movie, so it won't be available through Netflix, Blockbuster or Redbox, etc.

A10, V10. Great movie. Can't believe Anna Paquin is playing a 16 year old when she's 30, but she's totally believable. If you are after car chases ans explosions, forget it. If you like great drama, well acted, go for it.
